page.title: 01HOLT AND DISTRICT.
page.content: {HOLT}IS A SMALL MARKET TOWN JUST A FEW MILES FROM THE NORTH NORFOLK COAST. MOST OF THE TOWN WAS DESTROYED BY FIRE IN{1708}AND FINE GEORGIAN BUILDINGS REPLACED THE EARLIER TUDOR HOUSES. SMALL STREETS AND ALLEYWAYS, FILLED WITH QUAINT FLINT COTTAGES, LEAD OFF THE HIGH STREET. THERE ARE MANY SHOPS SELLING GIFTS AND ANTIQUES. SOME OF THE LOCAL ARTS AND CRAFTS ARE WELL REPRESENTED. THE SURROUNDING COUNTRYSIDE IS WILD AND BEAUTIFUL. A FINE{COUNTRY PARK}IS A GOOD PLACE TO TAKE A LEISURELY STROLL, AND THERE ARE SEVERAL INTRESTING HISTORIC HOMES TO VISIT. MOST OF THE FARMS IN THE AREA ARE ARABLE, AND PRODUCE MUCH OF THE REGION'S CEREAL CROPS AND SUGAR-BEET. THE TOWN IS A GOOD CENTRE FOR AN INTERESTING COUNTRY HOLIDAY. HOLT HAS A FINE PUBLIC SCHOOL FOUNDED BY SIR JOHN GRESHAM IN{1555.
